metadata.name: Suspicious AppX Package Locations
metadata.comment: Detects an appx package added the pipeline of the "to be processed" packages which is located in suspicious locations

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM scheduled_job_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (metadata.event_code = 854 AND (contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('c:\\users\\public\\')) OR contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('/users/public/')) OR contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('c:\\perflogs\\')) OR contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('c:/perflogs/')) OR contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('\\desktop\\')) OR contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('/desktop/')) OR contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('\\downloads\\')) OR contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('/downloads/')) OR contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('c:\\windows\\temp\\')) OR contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('c:/windows/temp/')) OR contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('\\appddata\\local\\temp\\')) OR contains(lower(job.file.path), lower('/appddata/local/temp/'))))

output.summary: Detects an appx package added the pipeline of the "to be processed" packages which is located in suspicious locations

metadata.objective: False positive: Unknown References: Internal Research, https://www.sentinelone.com/labs/inside-malicious-windows-apps-for-malware-deployment/, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/appxpkg/troubleshooting, https://news.sophos.com/en-us/2021/11/11/bazarloader-call-me-back-attack-abuses-windows-10-apps-mechanism/
